DataElement.preferredDefinition: The description of the reason the vital status during follow-up is unknown.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Follow-up Unknown Vital Status Subject Status Domain
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to subject status._The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done._Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused._The state or condition of being living or deceased; also includes the case where the vital status is unknown.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to subject status.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to subject status.

Property.preferredDefinition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.:Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.:The state or condition of being living or deceased; also includes the case where the vital status is unknown.

Concepts.definition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
The state or condition of being living or deceased; also includes the case where the vital status is unknown.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.
